```{r setup, include=FALSE, message=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)

library(tidyverse)
library(tidyquant)


```



```{r}
# set the stock ticker and the start and end dates for the data that you want to download. For example:

ticker <- "MSFT"  # Set the stock ticker
```


```{r}
# Use the tq_get() function from the tidyquant package to download the stock data. This function returns a data frame containing the date, open, high, low, and close prices for each day. For example:

stock_data <- tq_get(ticker, get = "stock.prices", from = "2022-01-01")

stock_data
```


```{r}
# Use the ggplot2 package to create a line chart of the stock's closing price over time. You can do this by using the ggplot() and geom_line() functions, and setting the x aesthetic to the date column and the y aesthetic to the close column. For example:

ggplot(stock_data, aes(x = date, y = close)) +
  geom_line()
```


```{r}
############

#with only a start and no end date
aapl_prices  <- tq_get("AAPL", get = "stock.prices", from = "2022-01-01")
aapl_prices
```


```{r}
aapl_prices %>% 
  arrange(desc(date))
```


```{r}
aapl_prices %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = date, y = close)) +
  geom_line() +
  labs(title = "AAPL Line Chart", y = "Closing Price", x = "")
```


```{r}
# simple moving averages

aapl_prices %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = date, y = close)) +
  geom_line() +
  labs(title = "AAPL Line Chart", y = "Closing Price", x = "") +
  geom_ma(ma_fun = SMA, n = 30, linetype = 5, color = "darkblue", size = 1.25) +
  geom_ma(ma_fun = SMA, n = 50, color = "red", size = 1.25) +
  theme_minimal()
```


```{r}
### multiple companies


#with only a start and no end date
mycompanies  <- tq_get(c("AAPL", "MSFT", "NYT", "XOM"), get = "stock.prices", from = "2022-01-01")
mycompanies 

mycompanies %>% 
  count(symbol)
```


```{r}
mycompanies %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = date, y = close)) +
  geom_line() +
  labs(title = "", y = "Closing Price", x = "") +
  facet_wrap(~ symbol, ncol = 2, scale = "free_y")
```


```{r}
# simple moving averages

mycompanies %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = date, y = close)) +
  geom_line() +
  labs(title = "", y = "Closing Price", x = "") +
  geom_ma(ma_fun = SMA, n = 30, linetype = 5, color = "darkblue", size = 1.25) +
  geom_ma(ma_fun = SMA, n = 50, color = "red", size = 1.25) +
  facet_wrap(~ symbol, ncol = 2, scale = "free_y") +
  theme_minimal()
```

# FRED Economic Data

```{r}
# US Regular All Formulations Gas Price (GASREGW), weekly
gasprices_weekly <- tq_get("GASREGW", get = "economic.data", from = "2022-01-01")
gasprices_weekly
```


```{r}
ggplot(gasprices_weekly, aes(x = date, y = price)) +
  geom_line(color = "darkred") +
  theme_minimal()
```


```{r}
# 30 year mortgage rate average, weekly
mortgate_30yr_weekly <- tq_get("MORTGAGE30US", get = "economic.data", from = "2022-01-01")
mortgate_30yr_weekly
```


```{r}
#both on one chart?
combined <- ggplot(NULL, aes(x = date, y = price)) +
  geom_line(data = mortgate_30yr_weekly, color = "darkgreen") +
  geom_line(data = gasprices_weekly, color = "darkred") +
  theme_minimal()

combined

```


```{r}
# import stock data
stock_data <- tq_get("AAPL", from = "2010-01-01", to = "2020-01-01")

# Creating a scatter plot:
# create a scatter plot of stock prices
ggplot(stock_data, aes(x = date, y = close)) + 
  geom_point() + 
  ggtitle("Scatter Plot of Stock Prices") + 
  xlab("Date") + 
  ylab("Close Price")
```


```{r}
# Creating a line plot:
# create a line plot of stock prices
ggplot(stock_data, aes(x = date, y = close)) + 
  geom_line() +
  geom_smooth(method = "loess") +
  ggtitle("Line Plot of Stock Prices") + 
  xlab("Date") + 
  ylab("Close Price")
```


```{r}
# Creating a bar plot:

# calculate stock returns
stock_data$returns <- ROC(stock_data$close)

# create a bar plot of stock returns
ggplot(stock_data, aes(x = date, y = returns)) + 
  geom_bar(stat = "identity", fill = "blue") +
  ggtitle("Bar Plot of Stock Returns") + 
  xlab("Date") + 
  ylab("Returns")
```


```{r}
# Creating a histogram:
# create a histogram of stock returns
ggplot(stock_data, aes(x = returns)) + 
  geom_histogram(binwidth = 0.01) +
  geom_density() +
  ggtitle("Histogram of Stock Returns") + 
  xlab("Returns") + 
  ylab("Frequency")
```


```{r}
# Creating a box plot:
# create a box plot of stock returns
ggplot(stock_data, aes(x = year(date), y = returns)) + 
  geom_boxplot(fill = "blue") +
  ggtitle("Box Plot of Stock Returns by Year") + 
  xlab("Year") + 
  ylab("Returns")
```


```{r}
# Creating a heatmap:
# calculate daily returns
stock_data$day_returns <- ROC(stock_data$close, type = "discrete")

# create a heatmap of daily returns
ggplot(stock_data, aes(x = year(date), y = month(date), fill = day_returns)) +
  geom_tile() +
  scale_fill_gradient(low = "white", high = "red") +
  ggtitle("Heatmap of Daily Returns") +
  xlab("Year") +
  ylab("Month")

```
